STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 13, 2024
Keisha Taylor
Clarence Fischer Center
1020 Commerce Dr.
Vassar, MI, 48768-9589
Re: License #: CI790363049
SI #: 2024SIC0001596
Dear Ms. Taylor:
Attached is the AMENDED Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility.
Due to the violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required.
The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-
6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
THIS REPORT CONTAINS QUOTED PROFANITY
AMENDED
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2024SIC0001596
Special Investigation Intake Date: July 16, 2024
License #: CI790363049
Licensee Group Organization: Wolverine Human Services
Licensee Designee: Judith Fischer
Chief Administrator: Keisha Taylor
Agency Name: CLARENCE FISCHER CENTER
Agency Address: 1020 COMMERCE DR
VASSAR, MI 48768-9589
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 02/09/2026
Capacity: 60
II. METHODOLOGY

Method

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention; prohibited
Title restraints; elimination of restraints.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
Description manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 7/15/24, youth was being combative and was approached by
staff to deescalate his behavior. A staff began escalating and
being combative with his language towards youth. Staff was asked
to leave by two other staff due to escalating youth and creating an
unsafe environment. Youth continued to escalate and began being
violent and was placed in an appropriate restraint. The staff
grabbed youth's feet, pulled them from underneath him and forced
youth to the ground. Once youth was on the ground, his behavior
began escalating creating an emergency requiring more staff.
Youth reported his head being hurt and was seen by medical staff.
Investigation The Complainant was anonymous.
2

Administrator was interviewed via telephone and in person
July 19, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Administrator described Youth A trying to get to someone to fight
so staff formed a line to keep Youth A from getting to whomever
Youth A wanted to fight. Administrator stated he left to do laundry,
came back and Youth A was in a restraint with Supervisor and
Staff 2 against the wall thrashing his body. Administrator reported
Youth A was fighting the restraint, both staff were struggling to
maintain hold and Administrator was afraid Youth A was going to
hit his head. Administrator described telling staff to go to an
emergency restraint and move Youth A to the floor. Administrator
reported he “grabbed Youth A’s feet and helped to the ground.”
Administrator stated it was not a proper restraint technique, but it
was done safely, and Youth A was not injured. Administrator
denied seeing Youth A hit his head or have any injuries.
Administrator denied being escalated or combative with Youth A.
Administrator stated Youth A was calling him fat, a “white bitch”
and was targeting him. Administrator reported he was calm and
“did not lose my cool.” Administrator stated Staff 3 asked
Administrator to leave and later told Administrator his tone was
antagonizing Youth A. Administrator reported he did not leave,
and his tone of voice was strong but denied antagonizing Youth A.
Administrator stated there is a fine line between staying and
escalating a youth or leaving the situation. Administrator reported
he did not feel he was making Youth A more agitated.
Administrator stated he was telling Youth A he could not act that
way, disrespect staff and then expect to go to the gym.
Administrator described resigning yesterday (July 18, 2024).
Administrator stated he was going to be wrote up for the improper
restraint, which would have been warranted. Administrator stated
he takes responsibility for his actions but feels other staff are
deflecting. Administrator stated he “made a shitty decision.”
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 19,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A described
being in a restraint and being thrown to the ground by Staff 1
causing him to hit his head. Youth A reported he was placed in a
restraint because he was trying to get to a youth to fight. Youth A
denied seeing the nurse. Youth A stated he told Supervisor his
head hurt and was given some Motrin. Youth A reported
Administrator, Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 were involved in the
restraint. Youth A denied Administrator saying anything to him
during the restraint or not doing the restraint correctly. Youth A
stated Staff 1 was the only staff that did not do the restraint
appropriately because Staff 1 was the one that made him hit his
head.
3

Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on July
19, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Therapist
described Youth A as being aggressive toward his peers.
Therapist stated recently Youth A was trying to get to one of his
peers and the peer had to stand behind staff so Youth A could not
get to him. Therapist reported Youth A does not have good
insight and being around people he does not know increases his
anxiety. Therapist denied having concerns regarding Youth A’s
placement at the facility.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 19,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B described
being at the facility for one week. Youth B denied being in any
restraints, seeing any restraints or hearing youth talk about
concerns with restraints. Youth B reported he feels safe at the
facility.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 19,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth C described
being at the facility for one week. Youth C denied being in any
restraints or seeing any youth be in restraints. Youth C stated he
has not heard any youth have been injured in restraints.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 19,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth D described
seeing Youth A be restrained a few different times in one day by
multiple staff. Youth D stated Youth A is” horrible” and does
whatever he wants. Youth D stated he could not recall all the staff
involved in the restraints. Youth D denied seeing or hearing staff
do or say anything inappropriate. Youth D reported he did not
believe Youth A was hurt in the restraint.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
8, 2024. Youth E denied having any concerns with how staff do
restraints. Youth E reported he has not heard staff say or have
seen staff do anything inappropriate during restraints. Youth E is
unaware of any youth getting injured during a restraint.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 19,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 described
Youth A being in three restraints on July 15, 2024. Staff 1
reported Administrator was only involved in the last restraint. Staff
1 stated when she entered the hallway Youth A was in a standing
restraint with Supervisor and Program Director. Staff 1 described
Youth A calling Administrator a “fucking white bitch” and was
4

threatening to kill people. Staff 1 denied Administrator said
anything to Youth A and described Administrator as “calm.” Staff
1 reported Administrator grabbed Youth A’s feet and lifted them
up. Staff 1 stated staff are not trained to do a restraint that way.
Staff 1 reported she was not very involved in the restraint as she
only guided Youth A’s head when he moved to the floor. Staff 1
denied Youth A hit his head on the ground at any time. Staff 1
reported Youth A did not fall to the ground as the staff around
Youth A helped guide him to the floor when Administrator pulled
up on Youth A’s legs. Staff 1 stated other than Administrator
grabbing Youth A’s legs and lifting she had no concerns with the
restraint.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 19,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 described
being in a restraint with Youth A because Youth A was pushing
staff and trying to get to another staff. Staff 2 reported Youth A
was calling Administrator a “fat bitch.” Staff 2 denied
Administrator said anything back to Youth A. Staff 2 stated
Administrator told staff if Youth A pushed staff again Youth A
needed to be restrained. Staff 2 described Youth A pushing staff,
so Staff 3 and Staff 5 initiated a standing restraint. Staff 2
reported Youth A was fighting against Staff 3, so Staff 2 switched
out Staff 3. Staff 2 stated Youth A was threatening to kick
Administrator, Administrator grabbed Youth A’s legs and told Staff
2 and Staff 5 to move to an emergency restraint. Staff 2 reported
Staff 2 and Staff 5 were supporting Youth A by his arms and Staff
1 had Youth A’s head as Youth A was guided to the floor. Staff 2
denied Youth A ever hit his head. Staff 2 stated Administrator did
not use the correct technique “to take the legs like that.” Staff 2
reported everything else was done correctly. Staff 2 stated
Administrator was calm while talking with Youth A and only told
Youth A he “could not push staff.”
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on July
19, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor
described Youth A running around the unit, pushing staff, and
calling Administrator a “white ass.” Supervisor stated
Administrator told staff if Youth A continues to push staff to place
Youth A in a restraint. Supervisor denied hearing Administrator
say anything inappropriate to Youth A. Supervisor reported Youth
A pushed staff and was placed in a standing restraint. Supervisor
described Youth A fighting the restraint, moving his body back and
forth and moving up against the wall. Supervisor denied ever
seeing Youth A hit his head. Supervisor reported while Youth A
was in the standing restraint Administrator grabbed Youth A’s legs
5

and lifted. Supervisor stated Youth A was not kicking
Administrator and staff are not trained to grab youths’ legs like
Administrator grabbed Youth A’s legs. Supervisor stated
Administrator was switched out and asked to leave. Supervisor
reported Administrator was escalating the situation because Youth
A was directing his anger at Administrator. Supervisor denied
Administrator said anything inappropriate to Youth A. Supervisor
reported it was an inappropriate restraint technique by
Administrator.
Program Director was interviewed face to face at the facility
on July 19, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Program Director described walking in and seeing Youth A
pushing staff and threatening to punch them as Youth A was
trying to get to another youth in the cafeteria. Program Director
reported Youth A struck Staff 3 so Supervisor and Staff 3 placed
Youth A in a standing restraint. Program Director stated Youth A
was fighting the restraint and swearing at Administrator and Staff
1. Program Director reported Administrator said “he’s [Youth A]
not going to keep doing this,” bent over and pulled Youth A’s feet
out from underneath him. Program Director stated Administrator
kept pulling back while Supervisor and Staff 3 had Youth A in a
high hold. Program Director described when Youth A was guided
to the floor Program Director had his hand under Youth A’s head
until Staff 1 took over supporting Youth A’s head. Program
Director denied Youth A ever hit his head during the restraint.
Program Director reported staff are not trained to grab a youths’
legs like Administrator did during the restraint. Program Director
stated Administrator was saying things to Youth A that were
“taunting” in nature but could not recall exactly what Administrator
said. Program Director reported Administrator was asked to leave
the area once by Supervisor and again by Program Director.
Program Director stated Administrator left the area and Youth A
calmed down a minute or two later and was released from the
restraint.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 30,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 described
Youth A pushing staff, being aggressive, threatening staff, and
telling Administrator he was going to “blow your shit up” when he
was placed in a standing restraint by Supervisor and herself. Staff
3 stated Youth A was fighting the restraint, moving his body back
and forth. Staff 3 reported Administrator grabbed Youth A’s legs
from up under him. Staff 3 stated she was unsure why
Administrator grabbed Youth A’s legs as Youth A was not kicking.
Staff 3 described Youth A being supported to the ground and
6

Administrator being asked to leave. Staff 3 stated besides Youth
A’s feet being grabbed everything else was done correctly during
the restraint. Staff 3 reported Administrator “had us all looking
bad.” Staff 3 stated she was unsure if Youth A hit his head at any
time during the restraint. Staff 3 denied Administrator said
anything inappropriate during the restraint.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 30,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported she
was not involved in the restraint with Youth A as she was in Unit 2
with youth. Staff 4 denied hearing anything being said by Youth A
or any staff during the restraint.
Video Review
Video footage of 7/15/2024 was reviewed on 7/17/2024. Video
footage shows Youth A in a standing restraint and Administrator
bend down and pick up Youth A’s feet. Youth A is guided to the
ground and placed in an emergency restraint. It does not appear
Youth A hit his head at any time. Administrator appears calm in
the video at times leaning against the wall with his hands behind
his back. There is no sound on the video. Video footage is
consistent with staff interviews.
Documents Reviewed:
• Administrator’s personnel file: Administrator did not have
any discipline in his file and completed Crisis Prevention
Institute (CPI) training on 2/12/2024.
• Wolverine Human Services Behavior Support and
Management Policy: Policy states all physical interventions
at Wolverine Human Services will follow the principles
established by the CPI curriculum. Approved techniques
for restrictive intervention include standing, seated, team
control and children control position. There is no technique
where youths’ feet are to be lifted off the ground.
• Incident Report 189480238 for Youth A for restraint dated
7/15/2024: Incident report is consistent with staff interviews.
• Nurse Note for Youth A dated 7/16/2024: Youth A did not
report any head pain, stated had lower back pain and rated
2 out of 10. Youth A was observed by nurse running
around prior to the exam and also after the exam.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per video review and
staff interviews Administrator grabbed Youth A’s legs and lifted up
off the ground which is not an approved CPI behavior
management technique.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2024SIC0001356 dated 7/01/24, CAP approved 7/01/24
7

SIR2024SIC0001256 dated 5/13/24, CAP approved 6/26/01
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iii)Threats of restraint, seclusion, punishment, or otherwise
suggesting physical or emotional harm to a youth
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Allegation One: Staff threated to have other youth beat up a youth
and put him in a trash can.
Allegation Two: Staff member told a youth he was going to beat
his ass.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 19,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A reported
Supervisor once told him she would have some of the other youth
in the facility come beat his “ass and throw him in a trash can.”
Youth A stated no one else was around when Supervisor made
the statement. Youth A denied any other staff making threats to
him or other youths.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 19,
2024, and July 30, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Youth C denied being threatened by any staff or hearing staff
threaten any youth. Youth C denied being asked by staff to beat
up a youth and place in a trash can. On July 30, 2024, DHHS
Worker and I were informed by Staff 3 that Staff 7 threated to
“beat Youth C’s ass” the previous day. DHHS Worker and I
attempted to interview Youth C, but he was escalated and would
not talk with us. I attempted to interview Youth C once more prior
to leaving the facility and he would not talk.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 19,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker and again on
August 8, 2024. Youth D was interviewed face to face at the
facility on July 19, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
8, 2024. They all denied ever being threatened by staff or
8

hearing other youth be threatened. They denied being asked by
staff to beat up a youth and place in a trash can.
Staff 1, Staff 2, Program Director were interviewed face to
face at the facility on July 19, 2024, separately, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 4 was interviewed
face to face at the facility on July 30, 2024, in collaboration
with DHHS Worker. They all denied ever hearing any staff
threaten a youth they were going to have other youth beat them
up or put them in a trash can.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on July
19, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Therapist stated
Youth A has not talked to her about any staff threatening him.
Therapist reported Youth A does not talk with her a lot.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on July
19, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor
denied ever telling Youth A he would have other youth beat him
up and place him in a trash can. Supervisor denied hearing any
staff threaten youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 30,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 denied
hearing staff threaten to have other youth beat them up and place
them in a trash can. Staff 3 described on shift yesterday (July 29,
2024) Staff 6, a new staff, told Youth C he was going to “beat your
fat ass.” Staff 3 stated Staff 6 was immediately sent home and
has not been back to the facility. Staff 3 reported she was the
only one with Youth C and Staff 6 when this was said. Staff 3
stated this is the only time she has heard a staff threaten a youth.
Staff 3 reported she was the only one with Youth C and Staff 6
when this was said.
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone on September 5, 2024.
Staff 6 described being outside with Youth C and Youth C verbally
threatening Staff 6. Staff 6 reported Youth C was threatening
Staff 6’s life, saying he was going to kill him, going to fight him and
charging at Staff 6. Staff 6 stated he spoke calmly to Youth C at
first telling Youth C making threats was not going to help him
leave the program. Staff 6 reported he said, “Dude, you’re not
gonna touch me, that’s not gonna get you home.” Staff 6 denied
threatening Youth C. Staff 6 described another staff being with
him at the time but could not recall the staff’s name. Staff 6 stated
he believed staff was new. Staff 6 reported he was sent home to
“ease the situation” and no longer works at the facility. Staff 6
9

stated he could not recall who sent him home, but he believed it
was a supervisor.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 30,
2024. Director stated she was made aware of the incident with
Staff 6 and Youth C. Director reported Staff 6 was sent home
right after threatening Youth C and was fired. Director stated it
was Staff 6’s first day working at the facility.
Documents Reviewed:
• Supervisor’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary
record.
• Staff 6’s personnel file: Employee Separation Form dated
7/30/2024 terminating Staff 6.
• Wolverine Human Services Communication with Client
Policy: The policy states staff will maintain a professional
and therapeutic relationship with the clients served.
Analysis Allegation 1: The facility is found in compliance as per staff and
youth interviews only Youth A reported Supervisor threatened to
have other youth beat him up and place him in a trash can.
Allegation 2: The facility is found in non-compliance as per Staff
3’s interview she heard Staff 6 threaten to beat up Youth C
resulting in their termination.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Resident nutrition
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4149
Section (1) A licensee shall provide a minimum of 3 nutritious edible
Description meals daily unless medically contraindicated and documented.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth are given a certain amount of time to eat their meals.
Investigation Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 19,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B described
being given a certain amount of time to eat breakfast, lunch, and
dinner. Youth B reported youths are given ten minutes for
breakfast and 13 minutes for lunch and dinner. Youth C stated if
you are not done eating in the time given you have to throw the
food away. Youth C reported most of the time there is enough
time to eat every meal.
10

Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 19,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth C described
being given 13 – 15 minutes to eat breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
Youth C reported nothing happens if you are not done eating
within that time frame. Youth C stated youth are given a certain
amount of time to eat so the next group of youth can come in and
eat. Youth C stated, “staff just redirect, never take the tray or do
anything if you’re not done.” Youth C described having a timer so
you can keep track of the time for each meal.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 19,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth D described
being given 13 minutes to eat breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Youth
D reported if you are not done eating then you must throw away
the food. Youth D stated it is enough time to eat each meal and
he has not had to throw away his food. Youth D reported he is not
sure why meals are timed.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 19,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported
youths are given ten minutes to eat breakfast and 13 minutes to
eat lunch and dinner. Staff 1 stated youth get their food, sit down
as a group and then the timer is set. Staff 1 reported everyone
gets through the meals in time. Staff 1 stated she is not sure why
there is a time set for meals but she believes it is to get youth in
and out so the next group can come in and eat. Staff 1 reported if
youth are not done eating within the time allowed the youth has to
throw the food out.
Program Director was interviewed face to face at the facility
on July 19, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Program Director reported youth are given ten minutes for
breakfast and 13 minutes for lunch and dinner to eat their meals.
Program Director stated meals are timed so the next group of
youth can come and eat. Program Director reported if a youth is
not done eating once time is up then the youth has to throw their
food away. Program Director stated staff are given the same
amount of time to eat as well since they are sitting with the youth.
Director 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
August 8, 2024. Director reported youth are given a certain
amount of time to eat so the next group of youth can get into the
cafeteria to eat. Director stated breakfast is ten minutes and lunch
and dinner are 13 minutes.
11

Analysis The agency is found in compliance as youth are given three meals
a day.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered to increase how long the youth
are given to eat their meals to be in alliance with Centers for
Disease Control and FDA guidelines to ensure youth have enough
time to consume a sufficient quantity of a nutritious edible meal.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
September 13, 2024
______________________________________________________________________
Barbara A Cote Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 13, 2024
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
12
